DOC.HEADLINE: CLINTON BEGINS EUROPE TRIP IN ITALY
DOC.TEXT: President Clinton arrived in Italy early today to begin a weeklong 50th anniversary commemoration of the start of the World_War_II liberation of Europe by Allied troops . Clinton , accompanied by his wife , Hillary , and a small army of U.S. officials , landed at Rome ' s Ciampino Airport just after midnight ( 3 p.m. PDT Wednesday ) aboard Air_Force One after an eight-hour flight from the United States . After a brief welcoming ceremony led by Italian Foreign Minister Antonio Martino and flavored with military pageantry , the couple were whisked_by motorcade to the U.S. ambassador ' s residence , where they will stay while in the Italian_capital . Clinton ' s trip is scheduled to include five major speeches in eight days . He will meet with Pope John Paul II today between talks with Italian President Oscar Luigi Scalfaro and new Prime_Minister Silvio Berlusconi . Clinton goes_on to Britain on Saturday . His trip will culminate Monday with ceremonies at the Normandy beaches where Allied troops launched their D-day assault on June 6 , 1944 .
